channel.title: Posts on Anders Sjørslev Schmidt
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Anders Sjørslev Schmidt

item.title: Descion-tree analysis: A look on the FFTrees package
item.description: As medical doctors we use descions tree every day. Many observations from studies have been condensed to a clinical scoring system which aid the clinican in taking descions about further investigations on a given patient.

item.title: My Summer of Data Science
item.description: The summertime is upon us. Allright, in Denmark the summer has lasted for months already, which is very unusual. It kind of makes you think of Global Warming. During the summer I usual find some extra time to reflect on new learning goals in R, new packages to explore etc. Last year, I attended the UseR! conference in Brussels, so the strait-forward strategy will be to browse through the overwhelming amout of videos and materials fra this years conference in Brisbane.

item.title: My notes on - Effect size and sample size estimations for clinical trials
item.description: On my way to design a third and fourth clinical trial I found it useful to reflect on the way the previous studies were designed and what considerations I have made. Randomized trials are only as good as they are designed - and important considerations must be made prior to the initiation of the project. Often recruitment of patients may last for years and therefore a careful plan is needed to enhance the scientific outcome of the study.
